attributes.action: Withhold all contractual payments to the EU untill a Brexit deal is reached.
attributes.background:
If the UK thrives after Brexit, the EU is doomed.

I believe that's why the EU is making things difficult, but, we too can make things difficult by withholding the huge amounts of money we pay them until a Brexit deal is reached.

EU members are allowed to leave. Thier behaviour is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Ban log burning stoves that pollute the air
attributes.background: Myself and my disabled husband cannot use our garden nor go out our door without smoke and smell on our clothes and air. Smoke and smell come into the house if we open a window or door.
attributes.additional_details: Have reported this to fire services, who saw it and gave us masks to wear to get to church. Carers have witnessed the debris and smoke. Environmental health officer saw it and debris and did nothing but said he should have collected the debris.

attributes.action: Pass legislation for the use of indelible ink pens mandatory for ALL elections.
attributes.background: In an age where pens are as cost effective as pencils, there is no excuse why the use of indelible ink pens should not be made mandatory. Old arguments on cost and potential for ink to smudge are not relevant today. However, a perception votes cast using a pencil can be manipulated, is a concern.

attributes.action: Create NHS teams for the atypical patients & Stop them falling through the gaps!
attributes.background: I have spent my life living with complex illnesses, and this coupled with also having a rare illness, I have found myself falling through the gaps in the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Because my situation and symptoms are ‘atypical’  I have spent the last few years being passed around in the system to different departments and teams, but never being taken on by their services as I do not meet the criteria or “fit in their box”. This has been made worse by the funding crisis, as no one is prepared to take on the atypical cases.

I propose the creation of specialist multi-disciplinary teams to take on the atypical cases, so that no one also falls through the gaps in the system.

attributes.action: Increase the funding for additional support for prison officers well-being.
attributes.background:
Prison officers are in a highly demanding and challenging job that requires readily available support systems in terms of both their mental health and well-being. 
We are petitioning for:
More counselling with independent professional counsellors to deal with mental health in the work place.
attributes.additional_details:
7159 assaults on prison officers and serious assaults on prison officers has trebled from previous year (MOJ, 2017); impacting their psychological and physical safety at work, overall effecting the prison system in whole.
We think this intervention would be beneficial for prison officers, prisoners and society as a whole.

attributes.action: Conjugal Visits Allowed In The UK To Stop Reoffending.
attributes.background: In the summer of 2014, The Howard League released a report entitled Sex in Prison. It explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe, Canada and even the Middle East. Dr Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper.
attributes.additional_details: The Howard League released a report where it explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe. Lorraine Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper who visited Halden prison in Norway in 2014, where conjugal visits are allowed. As a result, Norway has one of the lowest reoffending rates in the world, currently standing at 20%. In comparison, 59% of British prisoners reoffend within a year of being released.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists from the road and allow them on the pavement
attributes.background: Cyclists should be banned from the road, as they can be dangerous to drivers on the road and they are slow and they block your path. They sometimes don’t follow the rules of the road when there is traffic and they go onto pavement. Hence why they should be legally allowed to stick to the pavement.

attributes.action: Post study work visa should be introduced again for tier4 international students
attributes.background: Post study work visa was valid till 2012. Now winning a lottery might be an easy task for an international student  ( that too is not a good example because of no public funds clause) but getting a job with tier 2 specifications is a nightmare for the students who arrive here on loans and much more.

attributes.action: Make all nightclubs and pubs charge the same price entry for men and women
attributes.background: With all the recent outrage about gender equality and the unfair treatment of women, I would like to highlight an issue which I feel should have been changed by now considering it is illegal to discriminate against someone because of gender: Nightclubs in the UK charge men more for entry.
attributes.additional_details: This is unfair and there is no logical explanation behind it.

attributes.action: Introduce a 'no-fly' list banning disruptive & dangerous passengers from flying.
attributes.background: Presently several politicians claim the lack of alcohol-licensing at airports is to blame for an increase in air rage incidents.  Therefore several are pushing to restrict in-flight alcohol-sales at airports and in-flight, which would punish the majority.
attributes.additional_details: Instead of punishing the majority of decent passengers, a 'no-fly' list, similar to the one the Americans have, would be fairer on the majority of passengers and more effective in preventing alcohol-related problems like air rage.  Also the prospect of being given a lengthy or indefinite ban from flying would likely provide a much greater disincentive to avoid breaking the law during flights.

attributes.action: Call for all people who mentally cause suicide to be prosecuted for MURDER
attributes.background:
This petition calls for 'murder' to be redefined so that if it can be proven that one person has committed suicide as a result of another person's/ other people's actions, a murder charge can result.
The punishment will be a starting point of a minimum of 15 years in prison (12 years for under 18s)
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are killing themselves due to other people's evil actions. There is currently no crime that has been committed.
Manslaughter is 'the crime of killing a human being without malice aforethought'. That basically means that if you physically kill somebody without intent or the mental capacity to understand your actions.
To force a person to suicide, a person must have such great intent to harm others. There is malice! Murder could be 'killing a human deliberately or due to bullying'

attributes.action: Stop paying wealthy pensioners the  tax-free winter fuel payment.
attributes.background: Our country needs to stop giving away  money to those who don't need it. The revenue from not paying EVERY pensioner the tax free money can better be used to help th struggling health system.

attributes.action: Minimum tax rate for tax avoiders -Raise ££bn extra tax for health and education
attributes.background: The introduction of a 15% minimum income tax rate for an individual or company would raise tens of billions in additional tax receipts each year to help fund health, education and social care without the need to raise existing tax rates, cut funding elsewhere or to borrow more money.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, tax avoiders can legally reduce the tax liability on their income to next to nothing without any restriction.
Any individual or company who resides or operates within the UK and uses a known avoidance scheme or has connected parties or subsidiaries registered in a tax jurisdiction where the effective tax rate is less than 15% should pay the new minimum tax rate.  This will apply to UK income and all income recorded in these jurisdictions whether or not it is remitted back to UK.

attributes.action: Provide better mental health services for 17 year olds
attributes.background: At the age of 17 it's one of the most stressful periods of your life and yet there is no support out there for those who have mental health difficulties unless you're already in the system
attributes.additional_details: CAMHS is for children and adolescents; IAPT is for 18 and over year olds. At 17, CAMHS say that you're too old to be in their care and IAPT says you're too young! So there needs to be a better system which provides for 17 year olds in the transition period to being an adult.

attributes.action: Calculate student maintenance loans in a fairer way
attributes.background: Student maintenance loans are calculated on a household income basis. This method is not Fair as parents are expected to make up the rest but can’t with a bigger family. The aim of this is to have the loans be calculated by disposable income per person in the household rather than the overall income
attributes.additional_details: Maintenance loans are currently calculated by household income rather than disposable income per person, meaning that some students may get the same maintenance loan despite their parents being able to assist them more financially, as parents are expected to make up what we don’t get of the loan. This means an only child will have more support than someone with 3 younger siblings because their parents earn the same amount which isn’t fair as one family is more able to provide support

attributes.action: Introduce a cap on the cost of postgraduate degrees
attributes.background: Postgraduate fees are not governed by the same rules that undergraduate fees are. Student are regularly left with a short fall and having to money to help pay for courses or living costs. There is no consistency with postgraduate fees like there is with undergraduate fees.
attributes.additional_details: Postgraduate courses can vary from £6000 up to £25000, meaning that students may have to find and extra £15000 to pay for the course after and if they receive the full £10000 loan from the government, that doesn’t include living costs! This is clearly putting a number of students at a disadvantage and preventing them from studying postgraduate courses as many will not able to find this amount of money. We should be encouraging education, therefore a cap on fees would be the best option.

attributes.action: Raise the motorway speed limit to 80mph for electric cars
attributes.background:
Almost all over Europe the speed limits are higher than in the UK.
We should raise the speed limit in the UK as well.
If all cars could go faster that would raise the pollution, so raise the speed limit only for greener and usually safer electric cars

attributes.action: Fund Sound Therapy For People With Tourette Syndrome
attributes.background: My name is Jason, im a 20 year old male who suffers from Tourette Syndrome, i have suffered this for many years now and can NOT get the funding to join a sound therapy course
attributes.additional_details: i believe sound therapy would be extremely influential into helping solve the ongoing problem "how do i handle my tics" or "how do i cure my tourettes?" the simple answer is, there is NO cure for Tourette Syndrome, however after research, and being a musician myself, music and drama both seem to reduce the amount i tic, i also underwent a short taster of sound therapy and it reduced my tics sufficiently, i want to help people without tourette understand and people with, to manage it.

attributes.action: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren)
attributes.background: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren) if the mother is forced to flee domestic abuse whilst she is pregnant or whilst the child is too young to choose for themselves.
attributes.additional_details: Abusive ex partners also use children as a gateway back into their victims life. Safeguarding restrictions being put in place is not sufficient. If the child has contact with the abusive parent, they are very likely to be exposed to domestic abuse when observing the parent in future relationships. This can be damaging and is not in a child's best interest. The abuser may also abuse the child or use the child to indirectly continue to abuse their ex partner.

attributes.action: Make it law for every alcohol transaction to require approved photo ID
attributes.background: Many shop assistants every day are physically or verbally abused for asking for proof of age when purchasing alcohol a simple change to the law requiring that approved ID must be shown for every transaction would help reduce attempted under age purchases and remove cashier errors in assessing age
attributes.additional_details:
A simple law that states no ID no sale on alcohol would remove the possibility of human error in judging people's ages and would help to Reduce verbal and physical confrontations if customers knew the law was no ID no sale.
Across the country workers have been subjected to abuse because of guessing a customers age who subsequently causes a scene in an attempt to intimidate the cashier into selling the product.
A No ID no sale law would be a simple fix so everyone knows where they stand.

attributes.action: Make the Treasury remove the VAT on fuel duty
attributes.background: If you buy fuel at £1.229 per litre, petrol or diesel, are you aware that 11.59 pence of the total VAT on the fuel you purchase is actually a tax upon the fuel duty, which is also a government tax on fuel!!!
attributes.additional_details: If the VAT on the fuel duty is removed, then the £1.229p cost of fuel will reduce to £1.02p!!!!

attributes.action: Prevent the DVLA from selling personal information to outside companies
attributes.background: It has come to light that the DVLA are selling personal information to parking companies for the purpose of pursuing individuals in respect of alleged parking offences

attributes.action: Make getting a tattoo legal at 16 legal with parental consent.
attributes.background: Waiting to be 18 to get a tattoo can be a long, hard wait but sometimes, not everyone can reach it. It's devastating. If getting a tattoo at 16 becomes legal with the parent's consent then people can get something symbolic before they go. This, I hope is something that many others will agree on.

attributes.action: Eliminate Tax Avoidance - Introduce 2% Minimum Corporation Tax based on Turnover
attributes.background: As an example, eBay’s total UK revenue last year was c£1bn and £1.6m in corporation tax was paid. This petition would see eBay pay a minimum £20m (12.5 times more).  All companies regardless of size would be forced to pay their fair share of tax including Apple, Amazon, Google and Starbucks.
attributes.additional_details:
It is reasonable to expect that all companies who wish to participate in the UK economy should be treated equally and the minimum corporation tax rate on turnover should be the price they pay.

The minimum corporation tax could be collected in advance at the point of sales and/or assessed annually based on reported turnover.

Incidentally, FTSE 100 companies, on average, have seen their corporation tax expense to turnover go from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years.

attributes.action: Raise the legal sex age to 18 years of age
attributes.background: Under 18 years of age we are classed as children therefore children can not make a decision on sexual intercourse as they will not have the correct mentality and full understanding to do so. This will also allow for children to get through further education instead of becoming teenage parents.
attributes.additional_details: At the age of 16 we are told that sexual intercourse is okay when that just is not the case. If you're not ready to be parents you should not be having sexual intercourse at 16 you should be planning on what you are going to do at college, not worrying about being a parent, and as explained you should be an adult to be a parent not a child.

attributes.action: Increase the Penalty for NOT STOPPING after an Accident on the Highway by Driver
attributes.background: There are far too many Drivers these days who HIT and RUN, at this time the Penalty is far too Low and needs a Large increase, many are Killed and it is Gutless Not to stop, I know some of these may have a reason like No Insurance or wanted by the Police, they are Cowards when the persons are dying
attributes.additional_details:
In the Media there are cases every week now, this needs Controlling with adverts detailing the Penalty increase, it is a shame where things are going these days making life Cheap.

Let’s try and get things Changed.

attributes.action: Spend at least 60 billion pounds every year in Defense by 2020
attributes.background: We, as well as British and US military officials, ask that the UK government increases the armed forces defense budget so we are able to protect our country from states such as Russia and North Korea. We must stop cuts to our armed forces at this critical time, to counter the threats that face today
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-41903960

attributes.action: The government must carry out a public inquiry into offshore tax havens.
attributes.background:
The UK wealth gap is widening and child poverty is increasing.  Yet the UK has seen a boom in the number of high-net-worth individuals.

To show commitment for creating a fairer society, the government must start by investigating the use of offshore tax havens.
attributes.additional_details: CEO pay is 129 times that of the average worker.  In 2000 CEOs earned 47 times that of the average worker.  In the 1970s the ratio was much lower.  Meanwhile, UK food bank use continues to rise, schools are underfunded and understaffed, hospitals cannot cope with the number of patients they are receiving and transport services are overpriced.

attributes.action: Ban Fines for Parking Ticket Mistakes
attributes.background:
Honest people who have purchased valid parking tickets are being fined because of genuine mistakes - such as accidentally mistyping number plates in car parks that use number plate recognition. 

The British Parking Association know this - but their appeal system but offers no help.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has nothing to do with fines for overstaying or not purchasing a ticket - this is for genuine mistakes.

Typically people have a single character wrong on their ticket - and still appeals side with the car park owners.

To anyone else - it would be clear that the driver had made a genuine mistake, and paid the correct amount for the time allocated.

This money making on genuine mistakes should be stopped.

A typing error should not cost someone £60+

attributes.action: Ban overseas investment in UK property
attributes.background: The UK / London has been experiencing large scale foreign investment in the UK residential housing market. Foreign investment is endemic causing overpriced properties to be built, sold or left empty etc.
attributes.additional_details: Research carried out by the BBC into investors from the Russian Federation, China, Hong Kong, Africa etc. shows buying property in the UK has reached epidemic proportions. Housing bought by non-UK residents could be used as a bank or to hide money (laundering). Wholesale, buying off plan of entire blocks of flats or buildings is causing the UK housing market to spiral out of control. The UK Government should adopt the New Zealand policy of banning non NZ residents from buying propriety.

attributes.action: Include software digital downloads in the Consumer Contracts Regulations (CCR's)
attributes.background: Software digital downloads are exempt from the CCR's. There's a trend developing where developers are producing software which doesn't do as claimed. Customers pay for downloads in advance and cannot get a refund if the software turns out not to be as described. Devs should also release demos first.
attributes.additional_details: This refers to PS4 and XBox digital download stores. Copying software (piracy) was once a problem but with subscriptions to gaming networks and digital signatures this is no longer possible, nor is it possible to use the games without these subscriptions. Some developers are now taking to "hyping" their games to promote pre-orders - to take money first and worry about problems later and there is nothing to stop the developer abandoning game support after sale. The CCR's are being exploited.

attributes.action: Save the UK FM Radio Signal
attributes.background:
In the next few years the UK’s analogue radio signal will be switched off and listeners will have to tune into digital radio instead.

The UK is NOT ready. FM sounds better and has better signal. DAB sounds tinny and car DAB signal drops out. 

PLEASE SAVE THE UK FM RADIO SIGNAL.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people will not be used to DAB systems and will already own FM capable technology and would struggle to make the change.

Older but perfectly usable stereo systems will become obsolete and people may not be able to afford new equipment.

The FM signal is a historic achievement and it works. Future generations will miss out on learning of radio frequencies.

A strong FM signal provides excellent sound quality for both music and speech, whereas DAB is significantly inferior.

attributes.action: Reduce VAT rate on fixed telephone lines and broadband
attributes.background:
Telephone lines with broadband are an essential utility for the 21st century.

Currently there is a 20% VAT levied on all services, other essential utilities are not subject to such a high rate of taxation.
attributes.additional_details:
The government is well aware of the benefits of a connected society and documents them extensively: https://www.gov.uk/government/policies/broadband-investment

Individuals and businesses benefit massively from internet and telephone connectivity and this in turn benefits our economy.

Other utilities which are essential, such as water, electricity and gas are subject to reduced rates of taxation. Telephone and broadband services should be treated the same, as an essential utility.

attributes.action: Require hoists and proper facilities to be installed in all disabled toilets
attributes.background: Whilst out I needed cleaning and changing. My nephew had to physically lift me out of my wheelchair and hold on to me to clean and change me. It was difficult and I could easily have had a fall and he could have hurt himself. All disabled toilets need a hoist and proper changing facilities.

attributes.action: The Houses of Parliament should erect a monument to Daniel O'Connell
attributes.background: Daniel O'Connell, often known as The Liberator or The Great Emancipator, was an Irish political leader. He campaigned, successfully, for Catholic Emancipation in the first half of the 19th century.
attributes.additional_details: O'Connell played a leading role in achieving Catholic Emancipation - including the right for Catholics to sit in the Westminster Parliament - and the values of egalitarianism, tolerance and human rights, which he helped instil, continue to underpin modern democracy around the world. A leading MP from 1828-1841, his philosophy and career inspired diverse others from Mahatma Gandhi to Martin Luther King Jr. to Nelson Mandela. It is time for O'Connell to be recognised with a monument in Parliament.

attributes.action: Health Insurance schemes MUST include cover for counselling & Hypnotherapy
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people are affected by mental health disorders & urgently need access to affordable therapies. The NHS simply cannot cope & our mental health services are in crisis. Astonishingly, the Health Insurance Industry does not consider 'health' to include mental well being & fails to provide cover.
attributes.additional_details:
Why does the Health Insurance Industry provide cover for your body but not for your mind? 

Why can you get cover or claim money back when you see an Acupuncturist/Osteopath/Chiropractor but you can't get the same cover to see a Therapist?

Hypnotherapy is quick & effective treatment for a range of mental health issues, including; anxiety, depression, fears, phobias & addictions - ultimately helping reduce the burden on the NHS. So why is Hypnotherapy not covered under health insurance schemes?

attributes.action: The UK government should impose economic sanctions on Spain over Catalonia.
attributes.background: On 1st October 2017 the people of Catalonia voted for independence despite attempts by the central Spanish government to prevent the referendum. Scenes were shown across the media of the brutality shown towards Catalonia citizens, but the UK's response since has been shameful.
attributes.additional_details: A fundamental British value (or so we teach our children) is the importance of democracy. A right to vote and determine the future of your own people is a right protected under the European Convention on Human Rights and a pre-requisite of EU membership, not to mention the hallmark of a fair and free society. The UK government's response should recognise this by imposing sanctions against Spain or taking other diplomatic steps to secure the rights of the Catalonian people.

attributes.action: Formally support UN condemnation of the Saudi bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera.
attributes.background: A UN High Commissioner has condemned the Saudi-led bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera as an "unacceptable attack on the right to freedom of expression and opinion". The government should explicitly support the UN and oppose the Salman regime's attempt to censor TV channels available in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UN High Commissioner is Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein:
http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/06/high-commissioner-zeid-raad-al-hussein-call-shut-al-jazeera-unacceptable-attack-170630111642647.html

It is unacceptable to tolerate Saudi interference in what British audiences should be permitted to watch. The government should issue a formal declaration of support for the UN and unequivocally repudiate such Saudi meddling in our sources of news. It is not for the Saudis to censor our television channels.

attributes.action: Begin review of road traffic offences and sentencing announced in May 2014.
attributes.background: An 'urgent review' into cycling offences will not make the roads safer. It's time for the government to stop chasing  headlines and immediately move forward with the comprehensive review of all road trafiic offences and sentencing that they announced in May 2014.
attributes.additional_details:
The government has an announced an 'urgent review' into cycling offences after the death of Kim Briggs. This was a tragic but very unusual case. Of the 400 or so pedestrians killed a year in the UK, on average two are struck by cyclists. Focusing on cyclists alone will not make the roads safer. The government announced a comprehensive review of all road trafiic offences and sentencing in May 2014. It's time for it to start.

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/charlie-alliston-cyclist-jailed-run-over-cars-vehicles-dangerous-deaths-a7959626.html

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/bike-blog/2017/sep/21/a-new-cycling-law-wont-make-roads-safer-and-could-postpone-laws-that-could

attributes.action: Request that any Brexit bill be itemised and debated in parliament and public.
attributes.background:
Since the vote to leave the EU there have been multiple figures given in the press over any divorce bill varying between 20 - 100 billion pounds. 
We the undersigned demand that prior to any exit agreement the divorce bill should be itemised and made available for parliamentary and public scrutiny.
attributes.additional_details: Daily updates in the national and world press regarding the so called Brexit " divorce bill".

attributes.action: Raise the Help to Buy ISA qualifying limit to £300k to match Stamp Duty policy.
attributes.background: It was recently announced that Stamp Duty was abolished for first time buyers on properties up to £300,000. However, Help to Buy ISA’s only qualify for the bonus on properties up to £250,000. I feel this qualifying limit should be raised to £300,000 to be in line with the new Stamp Duty.

attributes.action: Let the people decide whether Brexit included the single market & customs union
attributes.background: This petition requires the UK Governemnt to clarify by public vote before March 2018 whether the intention of referendum voters was to leave membership of the EU only, or also to leave the single market and customs union and related institutions as extrapolated by the UK Government.

attributes.action: Stop involvement in the Afghan, Syrian and Iraqi Wars and bring troops home
attributes.background: Our involvement as the UK to stop the ongoing wars is the problem.  People are unhappy that we are continuously involved in the different wars and spending too much money on the wars when we could spend it on something useful in the UK. This is a major problem and could assist other campaigns
attributes.additional_details: We are spending a net amount of at least £20.3 billion just until 2010 (combined of only the cost of the afghan and Iraqi war).Many sources state that we are spending at least 37 billion by 2017 a statement by guardian stated “By 2020, Britain will have spent at least £40bn on its Afghan campaign, enough to recruit over 5,000 police officers or nurses and pay for them throughout their careers. It could fund free tuition for all students in British higher education for 10 years."

attributes.action: Amend the National Lottery licence to specify the Operator should be a Charity.
attributes.background:
The UK National Lottery operator Camelot is a profit making Ltd Company which pays large dividends to Shareholders. It is NOT a registered Charity with the Charity Commission.
A requirement of the Licence should be that the operator be a registered not-for-profit Charity. The Government must act.
attributes.additional_details:
Camelot is NOT a Charity and is NOT registered with the Charity Commission. It should be a not-for-profit organisation.
Camelot's majority shareholder is a Parent Company called Premier Lotteries UK Ltd, which in turn is majority owned by a Canadian Teachers Pension Fund, specifically Ontario.
The last 2 year's dividends paid to this Canadian Pension fund (via Premier Lotteries UK Ltd) were £66.6m in 2017 and £84.2m in 2016. These are funds which could be utilised within the UK on good causes.

attributes.action: Ban all plastic shopping bags and instead only sell reusable shopping bags.
attributes.background: The impact of plastic bags on the environment is enormous. ... Approximately 100,000 sea turtles and other marine animals die every year because they either mistake the bags for food or get strangled in them, says Natural.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/nov/03/dramatic-rise-in-plastic-seabed-litter-around-uk
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/greenerideal.com/news/environment/0613-how-do-plastic-bags-affect-our-environment/amp/

attributes.action: Provide victims of the most severe sexual crimes anonymity throughout trial.
attributes.background: Currently victims of crimes under the Sexual Offences (Amendment) Act 1992 are given lifetime anonymity from the media. Despite attempts to fully provide protection during trial details of the victims name are made available to the accused; even in cases of serious sexual assault by a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls for other means of identifying victims such as pseudonym, case number or photo to be considered.
 
Sexual assaults are crimes of power and control, a name is a key part of personal identity so giving the accused the victim’s name adds to the assault. Much of what you do or are is linked to your name, having it makes it easy to identify, locate or contact someone.
 
Using a victim’s name within courts would seem to contravene Article 8 of the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: To have a public holiday on 21 October to be called Trafalgar Day.
attributes.background: To commemorate one of the greatest days in our history.  We should be proud of that victory in 1805.  It is long overdue.

attributes.action: Ban spice!
attributes.background: Local towns and cities are getting worse with what we call the zombie plague i.e. legal high SPICE. Businesses are losing out due to people being too scared of this epidemic, less and less people want to go into their local city or local Town! Something needs to be done about this all over the UK.

attributes.action: Relocate UK parliament and government departments somewhere outside London.
attributes.background:
The Palace of Westminster is in poor condition, requiring £4B of refurbishment work, at state expense. It's, also, regularly argued that government is too London-centric.
It's time to relocate government to a new common site, outside London, and use Westminster Palace as a commercial asset.
attributes.additional_details:
Today, Westminster Palace is a far from suitable place from where to run government and, overall, London is over-crowded, costly and detached from much of the country. Considering these points, I propose constructing a modern government campus, in a more central location, with good London transport links, perhaps, somewhere around where the M1 and west-coast main lines converge, in Northamptonshire.
The campus should include a station and accommodation for MPs staying away from home.

attributes.action: Change the law so that in court each side always pays their own legal costs
attributes.background: Going to court is hugely in favour of the party with the biggest financial clout. They can afford to risk legal costs that the smaller party can't. The smaller party has no control over the larger parties cost yet may have to pay them. There is no other business where you can't control your costs.
